Package edu.upc.essi.dtim

Interface GraphStoreInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphStoreJenaImpl
    public interface GraphStoreInterface
    Interface for a Graph Store that abstracts the underlying implementation of RDF graphs and enables the decoupling of the application code from the RDF API used to manipulate the data. The methods defined in this interface provide a simplified API that hides the complexity of the underlying RDF implementation, making it easier to change the database in the future without changing the application code.

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getGraph​(java.lang.String iri)
        Gets a named graph from the store.
        Parameters:
        iri - The IRI of the named graph.
        Returns:
        The named graph as a Map object, where each key-value pair represents a triple.

        Checks whether the store contains a named graph with the given IRI.
        Parameters:
        iri - The IRI of the named graph to check.
        Returns:
        True if the named graph exists, false otherwise.

              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> graph)
        Adds a named graph to the store.
        Parameters:
        name - The IRI of the named graph to add.
        graph - The graph to add as a Graph object.

      • addTriple

        void addTriple​(java.lang.String namedGraph,
               java.lang.String subject,
               java.lang.String predicate,
               java.lang.String object,
               boolean isLiteral)
        Adds a triple to a named graph.
        Parameters:
        namedGraph - The IRI of the named graph to add the triple to.
        subject - The subject of the triple.
        predicate - The predicate of the triple.
        object - The object of the triple.
        isLiteral - A flag that indicates whether the object is a literal or not.

      • getDomainOfProperty

                                     java.lang.String propertyIRI)
        Gets the domain of the given property in the given named graph.
        Parameters:
        graphIRI - the IRI of the named graph
        propertyIRI - the IRI of the property
        Returns:
        the IRI of the domain of the property

      • getRDFSLabel

        java.lang.String getRDFSLabel​(java.lang.String graphIRI,
                              java.lang.String resourceIRI)
        Gets the RDFS label of a resource in the specified graph.
        Parameters:
        graphIRI - the IRI of the graph where the resource is located.
        resourceIRI - the IRI of the resource to get the RDFS label from.
        Returns:
        the RDFS label of the resource, or null if it doesn't have one.

        Deletes all triples with the specified subject in the specified graph.
        Parameters:
        graphIRI - the IRI of the graph where the triples are located.
        subjectIRI - the IRI of the subject of the triples to be deleted.

                   java.lang.String objectIRI)
        Deletes all triples that match the specified pattern in the specified graph.
        Parameters:
        graphIRI - the IRI of the graph where the triples are located.
        subjectIRI - the IRI of the subject of the triples to be deleted.
        predicateIRI - the IRI of the predicate of the triples to be deleted.
        objectIRI - the IRI of the object of the triples to be deleted.

      • updateLiteralFromGraph

        void updateLiteralFromGraph​(java.lang.String graphIRI,
                            java.lang.String subjectIRI,
                            java.lang.String predicateIRI,
                            java.lang.String oldLiteral,
                            java.lang.String newLiteral)
        Updates a literal value in the specified graph.
        Parameters:
        graphIRI - the IRI of the graph where the literal value is located.
        subjectIRI - the IRI of the subject of the triple where the literal value is located.
        predicateIRI - the IRI of the predicate of the triple where the literal value is located.
        oldLiteral - the old value of the literal to be updated.
        newLiteral - the new value of the literal.

      • updateLiteral

        void updateLiteral​(java.lang.String subjectIRI,
                   java.lang.String predicateIRI,
                   java.lang.String oldLiteral,
                   java.lang.String newLiteral)
        Updates a literal value in all graphs.
        Parameters:
        subjectIRI - the IRI of the subject of the triple where the literal value is located.
        predicateIRI - the IRI of the predicate of the triple where the literal value is located.
        oldLiteral - the old value of the literal to be updated.
        newLiteral - the new value of the literal.

      • updateLiteral

        void updateLiteral​(java.lang.String graphIri,
                   java.lang.String subjectIRI,
                   java.lang.String predicateIRI,
                   java.lang.String oldLiteral,
                   java.lang.String newLiteral)
        This method updates the value of a given literal object in a specific graph, with the given old and new values.
        Parameters:
        graphIri - the IRI of the graph where the triple is located.
        subjectIRI - the IRI of the subject of the triple.
        predicateIRI - the IRI of the predicate of the triple.
        oldLiteral - the old literal value to be replaced.
        newLiteral - the new literal value to replace the old value.

      • query

        java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> query​(java.lang.String query)
        This method runs a SPARQL query and returns the result set as a list of maps.
        Parameters:
        query - the SPARQL query to execute.
        Returns:
        a list of maps containing the variable bindings of the result set.

      • runAQuery

        QueryResultSet runAQuery​(java.lang.String query,
                         java.lang.String graphIRI)
        This method runs a SPARQL query on a specific graph and returns the result set.
        Parameters:
        query - the SPARQL query to execute.
        graphIRI - the IRI of the named graph where the query should be executed.
        Returns:
        a QueryResult object containing the result set of the query.

      • runAnUpdateQuery

        void runAnUpdateQuery​(java.lang.String sparqlQuery)
        This method runs a SPARQL update query on the graph.
        Parameters:
        sparqlQuery - the SPARQL update query to execute.

      • runAnUpdateQuery

        void runAnUpdateQuery​(java.lang.String sparqlQuery,
                      Graph m)
        This method runs a SPARQL update query on a specific graph of the graph.
        Parameters:
        sparqlQuery - the SPARQL update query to execute.
        m - the graph where the update query should be executed.

      • getIntegratedResourcesOfSource

        Graph getIntegratedResourcesOfSource​(java.lang.String id,
                                     java.lang.String uri)
        This method retrieves a graph containing all resources (IRIs and literals) that are directly or indirectly connected to the resource with the given IRI, in the specified source and URI.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the source where the resource is located.
        uri - the URI of the resource to get the integrated graph for.
        Returns:
        the integrated graph of the resource.

      • simplify

        Graph simplify​(Graph m)
        This method simplifies a graph by removing all blank nodes that do not have any outgoing properties.
        Parameters:
        m - the graph to simplify.
        Returns:
        the simplified graph.

      • getPropertiesSameAs

        Graph getPropertiesSameAs​(Graph graph)
        This method returns a graph containing all properties that are the same as any of the properties in the input graph.
        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph.
        Returns:
        the graph containing all sameAs properties.

      • getSubGraph

        Graph getSubGraph​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> resources,
                  java.lang.String uri)
        This method retrieves a subgraph of a given graph, containing only the resources with the given IRIs and their immediate neighbors.
        Parameters:
        resources - a list of IRIs of the resources to include in the subgraph.
        uri - the URI of the graph to retrieve the subgraph from.
        Returns:
        the subgraph containing the specified resources and their immediate neighbors.

      • closeGraph

        void closeGraph()
        This method closes the RDF graph and releases all resources.
